description:
Supported Platforms:
• NETFramework


Utilize Windows Imaging Architecture (WIA) to capture and acquire images from scanners, digital cameras, and video streaming devices. Programmatically control devices or use the default WIA driver dialog to control the captured image's color, resolution, size, and more.


With the LEADTOOLS WIA package, you can:

   • Control any scanner, digital camera, or streaming video device that has a WIA driver 
   • Acquire images from a specified source
   • Use the default user-interface included with the WIA driver
   • Determine the currently selected device type at runtime
   • Enumerate all available WIA devices and enumerate all child items for certain specified parent item
   • Create your own user-interface to provide your users with a consistent look and feel with all deveices
   • Bypass the user-interface entirely for completely automated tasks or batch scanning
   • Control the type of image that is acquired (black & white, halftone, grayscale, or color) as supported by the device)
   • Control the resolution (dpi), position, size, and orientation of the acquired image
   • Use the Automated Document Feeder for single and multi-page scans, including support for duplex scanning
   • Use selection dialogs to allow selection of WIA source, or select among multiple WIA sources via code
   • Specify memory- or file-transfer mode when acquiring from a WIA device
   • Use compression for both memory and file transfer modes. The scanned data can be compressed using JPEG, JBIG, JPEG 2000, PNG, RLE, or CCITT G3/G4
   • Get and set WIA 1.0 and 2.0 properties that the WIA device driver supports 
   • Use WIA in multi-threaded applications

This is just a small part of a large technology offering called LEADTOOLS. To see all that LEADTOOLS has to offer, go to https://www.leadtools.com





Use the following link to register for a LEADTOOLS license file that is required to use this NuGet. The license file is free.
Additionally, the link provides access to the LEADTOOLS Installer. The Installer includes 100’s of demo applications with source code to jump start your development:
https://bit.ly/LEADTOOLS_NUGET
summary: Utilize Windows Imaging Architecture (WIA) to capture and acquire images from scanners, digital cameras, and video streaming devices. Programmatically control devices or use the default WIA driver dialog to control the captured image's color, resolution, size, and more.
